title: Bullard Says Fed Should Weigh Shrinking Its Balance Sheet Eventually
sub_head: St. Louis Fed leader says the central bank could consider letting its $8.6 trillion holdings passively shrink, without replacing bonds as they mature
body:
Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said Tuesday that he was open to allowing the central bankâ€™s massive holdings of cash and bonds to shrink at some point.
Mr. Bullard, who was speaking in a virtual appearance, was commenting on what he would like to see happen once the U.S. central bank winds down, or tapers, the process of expanding its holdings.
